interestingcomments.content: Photographers who travel to very hot places: what’s the best way to keep film cool? /!/ I’m from Interior Canada, so in the summer it gets hot, but not that hot compared to some other places. For a road trip to a desert, I assume one could bring a cooler to store film in. But what about trips to hot/humid countries like India or countries in the Middle East that you might be flying to? Or even really long desert road trips where you might be camping without access to a motel/hotel fridge. Do you buy a cooler once you get to the country, or find some alternative way to keep the film from degrading? I’m curious because I would like to do some extended traveling once the pandemic is well and truly gone, and I like shooting film when I travel because it doesn’t distract me as much from the sights I’m seeing. I have a really bad habit of “chimping” or looking at every digital shot I take to make sure it’s in focus.
